An encrypted message 3703907616798581853794363385069360008781511485690815588078561265025822649688409317046214270636839563835947687719035208210629348362782415142401743401747843 was intercepted. Due to a flaw, part of the RSA private key leaked. Can you decrypt the message using this information?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7870068694456451044364152567072285175953675912956074091561878029341322432602930054682771476200111056041995658022723079610653439925332216065954318048082833, e=5517629246111174187995703030619567320191892316946391752330005136390458868406034504083615370838716138860696329013220508475031066288203377234819030396480521, partial_p=15477666371266314498

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{x6m6i3p9}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3703907616798581853794363385069360008781511485690815588078561265025822649688409317046214270636839563835947687719035208210629348362782415142401743401747843
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.

n=7870068694456451044364152567072285175953675912956074091561878029341322432602930054682771476200111056041995658022723079610653439925332216065954318048082833, e=5517629246111174187995703030619567320191892316946391752330005136390458868406034504083615370838716138860696329013220508475031066288203377234819030396480521, partial_p=15477666371266314498
